intro: Heterophyllaea lycioides, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually alternate and vary in shape depending on the environmental conditions. Heterophyllaea lycioides produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, capsule-like fruits.
